job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Philadelphia, PA

review_title: Sensitive to Family needs during Covid
pros: ABIM has provided me and my family the ability to support each other during this extraordinary time
cons: nothing really bad to say hear

pros: The mission of the company is rewarding in itself.  The department I work in takes great pride in their efforts and work well together as a team.  The benefits at ABIM are great and better than most companies I have worked for in the past and many of the companies my family and friends work for (e.g. generous PTO time, 403(b) contributions, health care coverage cost, and work-from-home opportunity).  Each department has a budget for professional development so those who choose to take advantage of it do.  I just completed a two day management seminar thanks to the company.  The staff is rewarded with an in-house lunch or gathering at a local restaurant for meeting organizational goals.
cons: One thing I do not care for is the secrecy around salary.  I have found over the years working for the company that my job responsibilities have been similar to others but they are paid 10-20k more and I question why that is.  Perhaps my BBA is not enough.

review_title: They don't always get it right, but they try
pros: Great people to work with, great work-life balance, competitive pay, and awesome benefits.  This one of those rare organizations that actually listens to feedback from their employees, and cares about being a place that people want to work.  In the time I've been here I never felt like just another company asset.
cons: Sometimes they change direction too quickly; plans are made, and then forgotten.  Projects are started, and then replaced after being deployed, or sometimes never used.

pros: Good people, work-life balance, GREAT PTO (I get 6 weeks of PTO and in recent years I would only use a quarter of it but now I am using almost all of it and its great. I have heard from friends working at other companies that they get time but its a problem to use it whenever they want to.), awesome benefits, and nice work space including conference rooms.
cons: The compensation is not the best and very secretive (the salary for a position will become a little more transparent now that HR is planning to give you at least the salary range when you apply for an open position).

pros: Had excellent medical, dental, and other benefits. Incredible 403(b) contributions. Had great people, culture and work life balance.
cons: Management reorganization killed some of the team spirit. Delivery of work to date is now more important than quality. Changing from a non profit culture to total corporate, reducing or taking away benefits. People used to plan and complete their own work in teams, now we have a bunch of middle managers and PMs "planning".

review_title: Cares about employees, doing something important
pros: Great benefits, challenging work, fantastic work/life balance. Fairly low-pressure (non-profit).
cons: There are some issues prioritizing; everything is the most important thing, and the people who have proven they can achieve are tapped for everything. Work should be spread around more consistently.

pros: trying to improve processes, focus on community engagement, becoming more customer service focused
cons: taking serious heat from publications that seem to have targeted the company practices without knowing all supporting information.
